sanskrit_verse: जपित्वा त्रीणि सावित्र्याः सहस्राणि समाहितः । मासं गोष्ठे पयः पीत्वा मुच्यतेऽसत्प्रतिग्रहात् ॥ ११.१९४॥
transliteration: japitvā trīṇi sāvitrīyāḥ sahasrāṇi samāhitaḥ | māsaṁ goṣṭhe payaḥ pītvā mucyate'satpratigrahāt || 11.194 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who has accepted unlawfully without discrimination must restore alignment through disciplined recitation of Savitri three thousand times, followed by a month of living in cowherd proximity consuming only milk.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in conscious discrimination and lawful acceptance
Causation arises from misaligned intake and lack of discernment
Capacity-based responsibility is restored through purification practices
Restoration logic requires experiential reconnection with purity
Consciousness alignment occurs via structured vibrational and dietary discipline
supreme_court_application: In cases involving improper receipt or misuse of offerings, the threshold of responsibility lies in awareness at time of taking. The court shall direct completion of vibrational correction and environmental purification before reintegration, bypassing punitive measures entirely.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that improper reception disrupts energetic alignment; anupūrvaśaḥ prescribes sequential purification through sound and sustenance; proportional response aligns with causal disruption; reality remains non-punitive as action restores inherent balance.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Savitri Japa Completion Process under supervision
Assign Goshtha Vasaya Protocol for one lunar cycle
Implement Payas-only Dietary Restriction during restoration phase
Verify Consciousness Re-alignment through Vibration Monitoring Systems
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. This law executes pure restoration without punishment. Consciousness is the ultimate judge, reality is non-retaliatory, and alignment is the only justice.
